metadata.title: CVE-2017-5645 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In Apache Log4j 2.x before 2.8.2, when using the TCP socket server or UDP socket server to receive serialized log events from another application, a specially crafted binary payload can be sent that, when deserialized, can execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblog4j2-java - 2.10.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache-log4j2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
